intro: Comptonella oreophila var. oreophila, commonly known as the mountain comptonella, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. Native to high-altitude regions of South America, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically visited by various pollinators. Its botanical significance lies in its ecological role within cloud forest ecosystems and its potential for horticultural interest.
